intro: Tapinanthus lamborayi, commonly known as the parasitic morning glory, is a hemiparasitic plant that attaches to the roots of other plants to obtain water and nutrients. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae, which includes many flowering plants with trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, pale yellow or white flowers that bloom in the early morning. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and arranged opposite along the stem. Tapinanthus lamborayi is native to arid regions of Africa and is often found in disturbed soils.
